A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The way everything hangs together can be a little clunky\, but overall the themes of the film: what you do with your trauma\, why to fight\, when to fight\, when to resist in other ways\, etc are v. timely. It's refreshing to see a hoary and oversaturated pop property attempt to communicate distinct themes in a mature manner. Could have been 20 minutes shorter and had 15-20% more creatures. Occasional levity provided relief from some very grim elements and mood. Can't wait for Johnson's trilogy in five years.
